text: Bad Schussenried is a spa town in Biberach in Baden-Württemberg in Germany. It is on the Upper Swabian Baroque Route (Oberschwäbische Barockstraße). Schussenried Abbey, a former monastery founded in 1183, is in Bad Schussenried. The abbey is known for its church and Baroque library hall. It has a beer stein museum called the Schussenrieder Bierkrug Museum. Peat mining was an important industry in Schussenried until, the middle of the 20th century. == Geography == Bad Schussenried is between Ulm and Lake Constance on the river Schussen. The 48th parallel north runs through Bad Schussenried. == References == == Other websites == * Official website Category:Spa towns in Germany Category:Biberach (district)
title: Bad Schussenried
